title: Ukip at war as Nigel Farage demands party's only MP Douglas Carswell be sacked
text:
Ukip at war as Nigel Farage demands party's only MP Douglas Carswell be sacked Nigel Farage was enraged by claims Douglas Carswell scuppered his dream of getting a knighthood Share Comments By Mikey Smith 22:51, 27 FEB 2017 News Nigel Farage with Douglas Carswell (Photo: PA) politics UKIP descended further into a furious civil war tonight, after Nigel Farage called for MP Douglas Carswell to be booted out of the party.
The long-running feud between the party's former leader and their only MP boiled over amid claims Carswell had scuppered Farage’s dream of getting a knighthood.
In a newspaper column, Quote: : “As a party, how can we let a man represent us in the House of Commons who actively and transparently seeks to damage us?
“I think there is little future for UKIP with him staying inside this party. The time for him to go is now.”
Ex-Ukip leader Lord Pearson approached the Cabinet Office to apply for a knighthood for Farage last July.
Nigel Farage and Douglas Carswell (Photo: Getty) When it was promptly turned down, Lord Pearson asked Carswell to approach the government chief whip, Gavin Williamson and ask him to “get around the committee.”
But emails leaked to a national newspaper appeared to show Carswell mocking Farage about being turned down.
He insisted he had spoken to Williamson, but said Farage might have better luck going for an OBE for “services to headline writers.”
Read More Nigel Farage spotted 'gatecrashing' dinner with Donald Trump in President's Washington DC hotel Farage told the Telegraph the exchange showed Carswell was “consumed with jealousy and a desire to hurt both Ukip and me.”
Party leader Paul Nuttall is already under pressure after failing to win the Stoke Central by-election from Labour.
MP Douglas Carswell and Nigel Farage in Clacton-on-Sea (Photo: AFP) And donor Arron Banks has threatened to withdraw his millions in funding from the party unless they install him as Ukip Chairman.
In a letter to Paul Nuttall last night (MON), Banks set out his plan to make Ukip “relevant” again, which included bringing Nigel Farage back to the front line of the party.
Read More Bring back Nigel Farage and make me Ukip chairman, donor tells Paul Nuttall Quote: : “[Nigel] is our biggest asset and needs to become energised with the party once again and work with you to deliver UKIP MPs.
